neocognitron

Class SLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • neocognitron.SLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SLayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The SLayer object contains all the s-cells in each s-plane within a given s-layer. The s-layer receives an input OutputConnection object from a previous layer, and outputs an OutputConnection object. The object is also serializable so that it can be saved for further use.
    Author:
    Nicholas J. Conn
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SLayer

        public SLayer(int layer,
      NeocognitronStructure s)
        Constructor for SLayer. Is initialized to be a specific layer, using a NeocognitronStructure object.
        Parameters:
        layer - Layer used to access values from the NeocognitronStucture
        s - NeocognitronStructure used to dictate the structure of the layer

    • Method Detail

      • InitializeA

        public void InitializeA(int previousPlanes)
        Initializes each a weight matrix for a[planes][c-planes][window]
        Parameters:
        previousPlanes - Number of planes in the previous c-layer

        public void InitializeB()
        Initialize each b weight to zero

      • InitializeCells

        public void InitializeCells(double r)
        Initialize each s-cell.
        Parameters:
        r - Constant r

      • propagate

        public OutputConnections propagate(OutputConnections input,
                          boolean train)
        For a given input, determine the output for this layer. The input and output object are both OutputConnections. This method is also used to train the Neocognitron.
        Parameters:
        input - A square image containing the character to be recognized.
        train - A boolean value which determines if the layer should be trained or not
        Returns:
        The output of the layer.

      • train

        public void train(OutputConnections input,
         OutputConnections output,
         double[][] vOutput)
        Train the s-layer. Modifies the weights based on the input and output of the layer.
        Parameters:
        input - Input to the layer
        output - Output for the given input
        vOutput - v-plane output for the given input
